metadata.synopsis: Jaheira's default dialogue. Topics range from her past life to her current goals as they develop. Unless otherwise stated, her tone is confident and to the point. She's a seasoned adventurer with a sardonic sense of humour - and a little less cynical than she might present herself to be.

3.speaker: Jaheira
3.text: It seems that events at Danthelon's have overtaken us. My contact there just sent word - the Harpers have been fractured. Infiltrated by doppelgangers.
3.context: InternalNodeContext: I might need to revisit the flags here - for now the conceit is that if you've spoken to Ninefingers, but the Doppels in DDA are still alive, it'll be assuming DDA has been slaughtered.

13.speaker: Jaheira
13.text: It seems that events at Danthelon's have overtaken us. My contact there just sent word - the Harpers have been fractured. Infiltrated by doppelgangers.
13.context: InternalNodeContext: I might need to revisit the flags here - for now the conceit is that if you've spoken to Ninefingers, but the Doppels in DDA are still alive, it'll be assuming DDA has been slaughtered.

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: Perhaps we might have done something to help - or just fallen into the trap along with them. I have only myself to blame.

36.speaker: Jaheira
36.text: Orin knows the hunt. In one stroke, she places the Harpers beyond our reach - separates us from our pack.
36.context: NodeContext: Angered, little bitter laugh - she's been neatly out-maneuvered

71.speaker: Jaheira
71.text: Orin knows the hunt. In one stroke, she places the Harpers beyond our reach - separates us from our pack.
71.context: NodeContext: Angered, little bitter laugh - she's been neatly out-maneuvered

112.speaker: Jaheira
112.text: Orin knows the hunt. In one stroke, she places the Harpers beyond our reach - separates us from our pack.
112.context: NodeContext: Angered, little bitter laugh - she's been neatly out-maneuvered

102.speaker: Jaheira
102.text: Until we know who the false-facers are, we cannot trust anyone beyond ourselves.
102.context: NodeContext: Quick, quiet moment of bitterness - she caused his death, but we still have work to do.

30.speaker: Jaheira
30.text: Geraldus was the last true Harper in the city we could trust - and that availed him little.
30.context: NodeContext: Quick, quiet moment of bitterness - she caused his death, but we still have work to do.

96.speaker: Player
96.context: NodeContext: Appraising us - we spoke up against her when no one else dared, and we were right to

103.speaker: Jaheira
103.text: Except Geraldus. It has been some time since anyone dared rap my knuckles like you did. No less than I deserve.
103.context: NodeContext: Appraising us - we spoke up against her when no one else dared, and we were right to

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Except Geraldus - but you cast him aside.
79.context: NodeContext: Not self-pitying - bluntly stating that she blundered, and it cost us - but already moving on. The time for mourning is later.

98.speaker: Jaheira
98.text: A kindness, I hope. My missteps have cost enough lives.
98.context: NodeContext: Not self-pitying - bluntly stating that she blundered, and it cost us - but already moving on. The time for mourning is later.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: We're isolated. This is exactly what Orin wanted.
67.context: NodeContext: Bracing herself to tell us everything

17.speaker: Jaheira
17.text: And I was so busy telling you not to take her bait that I scarcely felt the hook in my own mouth.
17.context: NodeContext: Bracing herself to tell us everything

58.speaker: Jaheira
58.text: I have not been overly-generous with the truth. I came here to learn of the Chosen, true enough. But I set my Harpers searching for someone else, too.
58.context: NodeContext: Bracing herself to tell us everything

70.speaker: Player
70.context: NodeContext: Not self-pitying - bluntly stating that she blundered, and it cost us - but already moving on. The time for mourning is later.

106.speaker: Jaheira
106.text: A good question - I don't have an answer, yet, so let me offer an apology instead.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Who is this Rashemaar you had your Harpers searching for?
108.context: NodeContext: Not self-pitying - bluntly stating that she blundered, and it cost us - but already moving on. The time for mourning is later.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Orin targeted your Harpers for a reason. What was it?
78.context: NodeContext: Not self-pitying - bluntly stating that she blundered, and it cost us - but already moving on. The time for mourning is later.

42.speaker: Jaheira
42.text: A... shame of mine. Redoubled, because I did not tell you everything sooner.
42.context: NodeContext: Not self-pitying - bluntly stating that she blundered, and it cost us - but already moving on. The time for mourning is later.

31.speaker: Jaheira
31.text: Tell me - what do you know of a man named Minsc of Rashemen?
31.context: NodeContext: Name should spark recognition from fans - an old adventuring companion of hers from previous games.

43.speaker: Player
43.context: NodeContext: Initial 'Ah!' is meant to be a gasp of excitement (doesn't need to be 'ah,' can be a breathier gasp. This is just for FaceFX). Think a tween talking about harry styles.Kind of talking to the player rather than to Jaheira. Karlach is still trying to play it cool around Jaheira, but she usually fails cause shes' such a fangirl.

99.speaker: Karlach
99.context: NodeContext: Initial 'Ah!' is meant to be a gasp of excitement (doesn't need to be 'ah,' can be a breathier gasp. This is just for FaceFX). Think a tween talking about harry styles.Kind of talking to the player rather than to Jaheira. Karlach is still trying to play it cool around Jaheira, but she usually fails cause shes' such a fangirl.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: *Ah, Minsc. A legendary hero who made his home in Baldur's Gate. You're fortunate not to have encountered the madman and his pet hamster during your nocturnal hunts.*
72.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

105.speaker: Player
105.text: *Ah, Minsc. A legendary hero who made his home in Baldur's Gate. You're fortunate not to have encountered the madman and his pet hamster during your nocturnal hunts.*
105.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

39.speaker: Player
39.text: *Ah, Minsc. A legendary hero who made his home in Baldur's Gate. You're fortunate not to have encountered the madman and his pet hamster during your nocturnal hunts.*
39.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *Ah, Minsc. A legendary hero who made his home in Baldur's Gate. You're fortunate not to have encountered the madman and his pet hamster during your nocturnal hunts.*
5.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *The name is as familiar as Jaheira's own - a hero of the Time of Troubles who saved the city more than once.*
35.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Minsc fought with you against Bhaal before - perhaps he can help me.
33.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

95.speaker: Jaheira
95.text: Perhaps. He's one of the few people alive who has faced your father before.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Minsc fought against Bhaal with you... And I fear Bhaal dearly.
11.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: As you should. But your father can be beaten, with the right people at your side.

113.speaker: Player
113.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

62.speaker: Jaheira
62.text: Or a stalwart friend to one - that depends entirely on the Bhaalspawn.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: My mind is muddled, as you know, but that name sparks something.
100.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

88.speaker: Jaheira
88.text: Whatever blow to the head has addled your thoughts, take comfort - you and Minsc have that in common.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Minsc? Name doesn't ring a bell - but that isn't saying much, given it's me.
12.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

73.speaker: Jaheira
73.text: Ah, the empty head. The less forgiving bards might say you two have that in common.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I grew up on childhood tales of the Beloved Ranger.
89.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

21.speaker: Jaheira
21.text: And you still turned out as well as you did? Amazing.
21.context: NodeContext: She loves Minsc, just being a little wry and Jaheira-ish

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I know a little, but it's hard to separate the fact from the fiction.

44.speaker: Jaheira
44.text: You'll find he can do little to help there. Too much in the habit of blocking enemy blows with his skull.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: A warrior of your people. Formidable, by all counts - I'd relish crossing blades with him.

110.speaker: Jaheira
110.text: Do you know - I fear he would be just as happy to meet you.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Big, bald keeper of vermin, if I recall.

18.speaker: Jaheira
18.text: Not quite how the ballads describe him, but I suppose there's a certain charm to your version.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: How could I not know of the great ranger? He's a hero among heroes.
84.context: NodeContext: Amusement, imagining Wyll / the Blade of Frontiers as an innocent child listening to fanciful stories

101.speaker: Jaheira
101.text: Why am I not surprised that young Wyll was well-fed on folk-tales?
101.context: NodeContext: Amusement, imagining Wyll / the Blade of Frontiers as an innocent child listening to fanciful stories

50.speaker: Player
50.text: He travelled with you back in the old days.
50.context: NodeContext: Dry aside, vaguely amused before moving back onto serious topics

59.speaker: Jaheira
59.text: I sense you mean no insult, calling scarce a century ago 'the old days'. Which is considerably more insulting.
59.context: NodeContext: Dry aside, vaguely amused before moving back onto serious topics

60.speaker: Player
60.text: There isn't a Baldurian alive who doesn't know that name.

66.speaker: Jaheira
66.text: But few know of his fate, I think. I had hoped to keep it that way.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Minsc the mad Rashemaar? He's a legend.
85.context: NodeContext: Amused rememberance - her friend is exactly what the legends say

74.speaker: Jaheira
74.text: Larger than the legend, I assure you. Twice as loud, too.
74.context: NodeContext: Amused rememberance - her friend is exactly what the legends say

57.speaker: Player
57.context: NodeContext: We're being curt with her, but she takes it in stride

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: Am I too sentimental for you? Minsc is a warrior from the Time of Troubles - but more than that, he is an old friend.
9.context: NodeContext: We're being curt with her, but she takes it in stride

53.speaker: Jaheira
53.text: And the last time I saw him, I left him to die.

111.speaker: Jaheira
111.text: Before we ever heard of this Absolute, we received word of a gathering in the Undercity.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I suspect there's more to the story than that.
15.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not willing to let herself off the hook.

115.speaker: Jaheira
115.text: There always is - but that is still the fundamental fact of it.
115.context: NodeContext: Blunt, not willing to let herself off the hook.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I'm not sure what this has to do with our fight against the cult.

10.speaker: Jaheira
10.text: As it happens, everything. He was with me the night I first heard that name, connected to some cult gathering in the Undercity.

7.speaker: Jaheira
7.text: What we found was the first dark seed of this plot - a circle of cultists, with mind flayers in their midst.

107.speaker: Jaheira
107.text: We might have ended it there, cut off at the root. But before I could send for help, Minsc charged in alone.

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.text: It was chaos. He was overrun, dragged down beneath a mass of tentacles.

91.speaker: Jaheira
91.text: I had a choice: stay, and let word of this cult die with us. Or leave him, and live to fight another day.
91.context: NodeContext: Not looking for our approval or condemnation - just stating the facts

22.speaker: Player
22.context: NodeContext: No anger. She did what she had to, even if she doesn't like it

68.speaker: Jaheira
68.context: NodeContext: No anger. She did what she had to, even if she doesn't like it

51.speaker: Jaheira
51.text: The world takes much from those who presume to defend it. But, sometimes... you get to take it back.
51.context: NodeContext: She's been telling the tale rather coldly, but a little bit of fire in that last phrase

40.speaker: Player
40.text: And here you are. You made the right choice - don't second-guess yourself.
40.context: NodeContext: Baldly stating the threat - facts, not emotion

24.speaker: Jaheira
24.text: So don't be sorry, because I mean to use you if you're willing.
24.context: NodeContext: Baldly stating the threat - facts, not emotion

26.speaker: Jaheira
26.text: Infection. Indoctrination. Eradication. That has been the fate of everyone the cult has captured so far.
26.context: NodeContext: Baldly stating the threat - facts, not emotion

104.speaker: Jaheira
104.text: But it has not been yours - with your help, perhaps it need not be Minsc's, either.
104.context: NodeContext: A bald request. No begging or flattery - just asking.

81.speaker: Player
81.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback at how quickly we agreed to help her.

19.speaker: Jaheira
19.text: As simply as that? For no other reason than that I asked?
19.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback at how quickly we agreed to help her.

41.speaker: Jaheira
41.context: NodeContext: Understated and wry - she's touched that we'd agree so readily, but dryly wondering if that makes us as stupid as Minsc

90.speaker: Jaheira
90.text: The point is moot without a means to find him. Without the Harpers, we shall have to find another path...
90.context: NodeContext: Sigh and back to business - she needs to find a lead.

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.text: I'll have a better idea of what that is once we're through the gates. It seems I need to reacquaint myself with this damned city.

93.speaker: Jaheira
93.text: I'll have a better idea of what that is once we're through the gates. It seems I need to reacquaint myself with this damned city.

20.speaker: Jaheira
20.text: I'll have a better idea of what that is once we're through the gates. It seems I need to reacquaint myself with this damned city.

55.speaker: Jaheira
55.text: I'll have a better idea of what that is once we're through the gates. It seems I need to reacquaint myself with this damned city.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Why are you only telling me this now?
49.context: NodeContext: Explaining why she didn't ask for our help before. She's only now acknowleding that she needs it.

94.speaker: Jaheira
94.text: Because I was playing the pragmatist, and writing my friend off for dead. Then I met you.
94.context: NodeContext: Explaining why she didn't ask for our help before. She's only now acknowleding that she needs it.

75.speaker: Jaheira
75.text: If I seem suddenly flush with hope and soft feeling, you have only yourself to blame.
75.context: NodeContext: Wry, a little sarcastic - but not harsh. She's genuinely grateful to us

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Is this really more important than stopping the Chosen?
38.context: NodeContext: Back to being blunt and pragmatic - she's made an emotional appeal to us, but she'll back it up with reason too

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.text: You need not preach the cause to me - I've already told you what I sacrificed in its name.
52.context: NodeContext: Back to being blunt and pragmatic - she's made an emotional appeal to us, but she'll back it up with reason too

86.speaker: Jaheira
86.text: But only a fool would discard a potential ally like Minsc. He has faced god and illithid both, just as I have.
86.context: NodeContext: Back to being blunt and pragmatic - she's made an emotional appeal to us, but she'll back it up with reason too

97.speaker: Player
97.text: We can try, Jaheira. But we don't even know if he's still alive.

32.speaker: Jaheira
32.text: I'm not asking for promises. Just the chance.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I'm sorry, Jaheira. That's a cruel choice to have to make.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: If he's lucky, they killed him then and there.

28.speaker: Jaheira
28.text: If I was any kind of friend, I'd have loosed an arrow myself. Or so I thought - until I met you.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: It sounds like he got what he deserved.

54.speaker: Jaheira
54.text: Perhaps. He's not the first one lost to the cult, and unlikely to be the last.

56.text: *Despite her expectant gaze, the name means nothing to you.*
56.context: NodeContext: Dry aside, vaguely amused before moving back onto serious topics

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *Despite her expectant gaze, the name means nothing to you.*
109.context: NodeContext: Dry aside, vaguely amused before moving back onto serious topics

64.speaker: Player
64.context: NodeContext: Dry aside, vaguely amused before moving back onto serious topics

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: That depends entirely on the quality of bard you listen to.
8.context: NodeContext: Dry aside, vaguely amused before moving back onto serious topics

1.speaker: Player
1.context: NodeContext: Stating plainly - teeing up to say that she left him to die

48.speaker: Jaheira
48.text: Street wailers spin stories from the Time of Troubles, and they save the strangest ones for Minsc. It happens that in his case, most of them are true.
48.context: NodeContext: Stating plainly - teeing up to say that she left him to die

76.speaker: Jaheira
76.text: Minsc is an old friend - perhaps my oldest. We fought at one another's backs times beyond counting.
76.context: NodeContext: Stating plainly - teeing up to say that she left him to die
